On 3/12/06, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>=
 > A stateless abstract class is usually a Strategy, so I'd rather use it
>=
 > than extend it.
>
> Meaning you'd rather declare it as an interface?
>
>=
 > One exception is the empty Strategy, otherwise known as
> > an Adapter.
=
>
> That's a different definition of Adapter than I'm used to (or a
> diffe=
rent application).


Ditto.

Here is mine:  an adapter is a class implement=
ing with empty bodies some of
or all the methods of an interface.  You can =
extend Adapters when you only
want to implement a few methods of an interfa=
ce but not all of them.

What's your definition,  JB?
